Hello list,

by accident I just came across the Crawl-By-Example Plugin 
(http://webteam.archive.org/confluence/display/SOC06/Crawl-By-Example) on the 
archive.org webpage and was wondering if anybody can tell me a bit about his 
experience (performance, speed, quality of classification) using this plugin to 
crawl a specific topic (like sports, music, biology pages etc...).

In my current projects we like to collect topic specific documents. At the 
moment we are mostly doing website-classification after crawling, but it would 
be great to limit the number of documents already during crawl time. Are there 
any other tools/plugins that work with heritrix that can do a kind of "filter by 
topic" while crawling? Also any links to papers on this topic would be appreciated.

Thanks,
